Ren is right, money is just a human invention.    We created it out of thin air as tokens to facilitate trade.  Most people have swallowed myths about money, what it is, where it comes from.  The fact is, money is not lent to you from deposits made by your neighbors, banks create it by bookkeeping entry, by 'fractional reserve banking,' that becomes an 'asset' not a liability to them, to create more money, often 30x, 60x, at the time of the banking crisis some banks had 100x their assets as bookkeeping entry money.  The major source is the 'central bank' who spins it out of nothing and gives very low interest money to member banks as 'debt,' which they use the above to inflate, loan, but now mostly invest.    They loan to the 'best' customers, i.e. rich people, for them and those wealthy to become more wealthy.  Not for the citizens, not for the hoi polloi, not the proles, not for the benefit of the Common Welfare.  No, this is the worst case of 'trickle down' economics.  In fact this is how banks, and private equity, buy up... everything.  Then charge you rent in perpetuity.  These are your new Feudal masters.  But this is not the only way, money can be created by the government treasury, the mint, as debt free economic tokens, and not lent as the economic supply of money that requires interest back as profit on a thing invented by keystroke, but spent by the budget created by democratically elected representatives on the needs of the public, on the 'Common Welfare.'    So we can 'find' the money for infrastructure, research, education, healthcare, housing, childcare, pensions and disability, food security, etc.    No one need be in want when the money doesn't trickle from the top with nary a drop reaching the bottom, but flows across us all, and that money can find its way to banks for the simple practice of savings at 3% and loans at 6%.  Money does not have to be created by a private entity that 'loans' something it created by keystroke to the government or people it resides with, sovereign money, debt free public money has existed before, it can again.  And until we live in some Star Trek universe that doesn't need it, we're going to have to destroy the money myths, democratize our money, and take it back.  Because he who makes the 'gold,' rules. Sovereignty lies in the money power when monetary policy determines fiscal policy, determines domestic policy, determines foreign policy.  There are solutions for debt free money, monetary reform, banking reform, presidents have spoken about this issue before, but without the people, the politicians can not reform things by themselves.    I would love to see someone take this on like Ren does in Money Game, this may be a challenge to do 'monetary policy in a nursery rhyme,' with some nice graphics or cartoon depictions, but we need it.  You can find out more about debt free, public, sovereign money from a number of sources, like Alliance For Just Money, American Monetary Institute, Positive Money to name a few.
Much love, Ren... â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

So, first you made me realize i am a hypocrite, then you educated me on how the world operates and now you tell me the story of drive, influence and greed. Well played Ren! loved it! Great job Sam.
Once again Ren raises the bar. This hit me hard and i'll explain why. In the beginning when he described the childs first 14yrs he could of been describing my  youngest son, except for the fact i raised my children to think for themselves,to never be afraid to ask questions or stand up for themselves, to respect fellow humans but also to demand that respect in return. We were always short of money but he earnt his way into Grammar school.  He was always top of his class,polite,but....When he began questioning the teachers,searching for deeper answers that was when the phone calls began, the parent teacher meetings and why? because he wasnt afraid to stick his hand up,to question and challenge the teachers and when they tried to shut him down he stood his ground. Now im not the the type of person who thinks they're child can do no wrong ,but in these meetings i listened to their arguments and always the root of their arguments came back to him being outspoken and challenging teachers when he thought something was wrong,and might i add here that during those meetings it always turned out they had to admit he was right but that he shouldnt have challenged the teacher in front of the class. Never once in those many  many meetings when i asked if he'd been rude or disrespectful did they say he was,the one and only reason was because he used his voice ,and knowing my son at that age he could have debated with the best of them.  He was more intelligent at 11yrs old than many of his tutors and he was articulate in his reasoning with them and this didnt go down well.  Yes he could have backed down ,yes he could have let them talk down to him and yes he could have become part of the flock,perhaps many people believe that is what i should have made him do but no i stood by him and at 14yrs they expelled him. He never went back to school. Had no qualifications. Yet at 17 he got into a university on his own merit, he passed with honours and now writes software for the government amongst many. He has a family ,works hard for very little money . But more importantly he is honest, kind,respectful and incredibly aware of the corruption among society and thankfully is teaching his children to never be afraid,to stand tall and believe in themselves.  My point is ,the education system is as corrupt as the goverment and any child that does not conform to their standards or dares to question is in want of a better word quashed. The next generation is doomed if it continues in the direction its heading. Parents need to become accountable for the future adult they are raising. What has happened to commonsense? Just because we are told to do something doesnt mean we  should blindly obey. Thanks to the internet we have a wealth of information at our fingertips but also a world of misinformation.  Be it on YouTube,Google, social media or bloody tik tok is more important than ever we question everything and search for the truth and teach our children to do the same. Some days i feel like i failed my son and if id brought him up differently and silenced his voice he could of achieved so much more. But then i look at the man he has become and the father he has become and i wouldnt change a damn thing. Money isn't everything, integrity and respect for our fellow humans is.

I love this Ren & Sam, this is a great work of art. You are right pointing out the hypocrisy in the world and the flaws of a capitalist system. Great art is thought provoking and encourages dialogue. Although it is flawed, there is a certain amount of choice in the capitalist system, you can create in that system and vote etc. I don't know what your idea of utopia is Ren? In my opinion, the utopian idea cannot and has never worked as we are all flawed human beings. Once you bring in a system like that, you have no creativity, no free will, no ability to vote it out and no inspiration or ability to think and create. Can we all make personal choices about how we behave and how we treat each other, absolutely. Can we teach our children good values, yes.Just don't get fooled by the idea of utopia, anyone who has been to the Killing fields in Cambodia knows how that turns out. Brilliant work Ren and Sam (and team), I can tell how much work you put into creating this. Thanks for the great, thought provoking music/art.

my heart has been beating out of my chest with the money game, now mg3. great job ren- this is basically a tales, without the guitar.   my mind tells me that i should hate those like jimmy, but i've got to say- my heart bleeds for those like him, just as it bleeds for those whose lives he's destroyed. it's weird, i guess, that my logic tells me that i should hate others, and it's weird that i've been disappointed when ~despite the logic~ i don't hate those who "deserve" it.  but- logically, my mind also tells me that there isn't such a thing as "deserving" and "undeserving"; i've been disappointed when my heart tells me otherwise.  the longer i live the more lost i am in the wilds of logic and heart- but, the more i'm grounded in those wilds, too. there is, imo, only making the best of my logic, and my heart, and hoping that ~through me, and others like me, and others not like me~ there will be a world where ppl aren't "deserving" and "undeserving";   that my logic and heart ~and the world they live in~ will no longer be in the wilds. that my logic and heart, and all others', will no longer be at war.

A lot different then I expected and returning to more of a freestyle like the first money game. It is a great lesson in greed being our downfall but human nature is to want more. Utopian society would be great but until machines do all the work, people that work harder or risk their lives or study for years expect to live better for doing so. Most jobs aren't done because they enjoy it, it's because it allows them to live better. If all jobs paid the same, who would want to do the dangerous jobs when they could do something simple and safe instead?  We've created a society where entertainment tends to pay the most because so many people want escapism and where people throw their money, greed will find a way to capitalize, such as companies advertising.  To go to a money free system would revert us back to bartering which is still the same problem.. utopian socialism is the only escape but that's not in human nature because again all jobs are not equal

Tyranny is the death of nuance, as it was always those in power that kept the tradition of tragedies alive. Paper trails hold as much weight as a bank note does when dangled off the cliff of bills. Only to watch a cheque bounce off the rock bottom of our despair. How they reserve misfortune for the desperate, spitting in our faces only to call it a water utility on the record.  Yet, I anticipate Ren setting the record straight with this number, for there is no inflation within his barmy creations. Just brilliance, honesty, and community that will set us free from the money game that those ignorant of tyrants just call Monopoly. Thank you Ren, for all that you have said and sung to inspire more than what will be and already has begun.

Money Game pts. 1&2 are some of my favorite tracks out of your library. Your flex tracks are great too but these tracks are so reflective of this era in history. I'd suggest everyone who has been treading water these last 2 decades to watch CoinBureau's "The Financial System is Rigged!" for an expansion on what Ren touches upon in these tracks. CoinBureau is obviously pro Bitcoin but to their credit they never mention crypto once in this video. It is purely about how the system forces those at the bottom to rely on currency while those at the top rake in the money. FYI, those are two very different things. I would love for Ren to explore the dichotomy of the rich and poor, currency and money, and how that seperates the financially free from the financially enslaved.
